intro: Egletes commixta, commonly known as the African nightshade, is a herbaceous plant native to parts of Africa. It belongs to the Solanaceae family, which includes other nightshades such as tomatoes and peppers. The plant typically grows to a height of about 30-60 cm, featuring hairy stems and alternate leaves. Its flowers are usually purple or violet, and it produces small, berry-like fruits that are toxic to humans and animals. Due to its toxicity, it is often considered a weed in agricultural settings.
